metadata.author: Converted from webber
metadata.description: Comprehensive English grammar with coordination, prepositional phrases, and subordinate clauses

rules.note: Example: very quickly -> SPECIFIER(quickly) with child SPECIFIER(very)

adj1.description: Build descriptors with specifiers and subordinate clauses

mixPrep.description: Mix different prepositional types via coordination

noun1.description: Build nouns with descriptors and subordinate clauses

rules.note: Example: cats and dogs -> COORD becomes NOUN
Example: on table and under chair
Infinitive: to run, to see (anchor becomes NOMINAL result)
Gerund as nominal: running is fun (PARTICIPLE  NOMINAL)
Participle as adjective: running water (PARTICIPLE  DESCRIPTOR)
Relative clause: the dog that chased
Relative adverb: the place where I live

aux1.description: Auxiliary verbs modify main verbs (modals, perfect, progressive)

rules.note: Modal + verb: can run, should go
Perfect auxiliary + verb: has run, had eaten
Progressive auxiliary + verb: is running, was walking
Example: dog runs and cat sleeps
Example: The dog, which was brown, ran
Example: He arrived, after lunch, yesterday
Example: The dog ran; the cat hid
Example: There is one truth: love conquers all
